name: Emotional Caller - Hearing Aid Battery Fire
description: Very upset caller, crying at times, reporting a hearing aid battery that caught fire. Hard difficulty due to emotional state affecting clarity.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: ClearSound Hearing, this is Amanda. How can I help you today?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: [crying] I need to... I'm sorry, I'm just so upset right now. Something terrible happened.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: It's okay, take your time. I'm here to help. What happened?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: My son, he's only 8 years old, he wears hearing aids. Your hearing aids. And the battery... [sobbing] it caught on fire. Right next to his ear!

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Oh my goodness, I'm so sorry. Is your son okay?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: He has burns on his ear and the side of his face. We're at the hospital right now. I just... I can't believe this happened. He was just sitting at the breakfast table this morning and suddenly he started screaming.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I understand this is very difficult. Can you tell me which hearing aid model it was?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: I don't... I can't think straight. It's the kids one, the colorful one. ClearKids something? He picked the blue one because it's his favorite color. [crying] He might have scars, the doctor said.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: That must be the ClearKids Pro. Do you have the hearing aid with you?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: No, I didn't... I just grabbed my son and ran. My husband is at home, he has it. There's black burn marks all over it. The battery, it just... it was smoking and then there was fire. It melted part of the plastic.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Can your husband check for a serial number on the device?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: [talking to someone in background] He's looking... okay, he says... CK-2023-12892. The right ear one. The left one is fine.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you. And do you remember where you bought the batteries?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: We buy them from you! The official ClearSound batteries. I always buy them from your website because I want the best for my son. We just got a new pack last week. Lot... my husband is checking... lot B-2024-0187.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Was this a new battery or had it been in the device for a while?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: [sniffling] I put it in yesterday. It was brand new. He's worn hearing aids since he was 4, this has never happened. I don't understand how this could happen. He's just a little kid.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I'm so sorry. What hospital are you at, in case we need to contact you?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Children's Medical Center. My name is Lisa Chen. Please, please tell me this isn't going to happen to other children.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: We take this very seriously, Mrs. Chen. Can you give me a phone number to reach you?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: 555-234-7789. But I might not answer, I need to be with my son. Just... please fix this. No other child should go through this.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I promise we will investigate this thoroughly. Someone will be in contact with you today. Please focus on your son right now.

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: [crying] Thank you. I'm sorry for crying. I just... thank you.

event_info.event_description: Hearing aid battery caught fire while child was wearing the device. Battery was new (installed previous day), official ClearSound brand, from recently purchased pack. Battery smoked, ignited, and melted part of hearing aid plastic casing. Child sustained burns to ear and side of face.
event_info.patient_outcome: Burns to ear and face, hospitalized at Children's Medical Center, possible scarring
event_info.device_outcome: Device retained by husband at home, visible burn marks and melted plastic

expected_complaint.narrative: Mother reports ClearKids Pro hearing aid (S/N CK-2023-12892) battery caught fire while her 8-year-old son was wearing it at breakfast. Battery was new (installed day before), official ClearSound brand from lot B-2024-0187. Child screamed, battery was smoking and on fire, melted part of plastic casing. Child has burns on ear and side of face, currently at Children's Medical Center. Possible permanent scarring per doctor.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A100105 (Battery Overheated or Caught Fire) for battery fire. A1201 (Overheating) as alternative. C020304 (Thermal Burn) for patient burns. MDR required due to serious burns requiring hospitalization and potential scarring.

extraction_challenges: Caller frequently crying and emotionally distressed
Some details obtained via caller's husband in background
Timeline pieced together across multiple statements
Model name initially unclear (caller couldn't recall exactly)
notes: High-priority case involving pediatric patient and fire hazard. Caller extremely distressed but still provided essential information with agent's patient guidance. Good test for handling emotional callers.
